page.title: 04BUILDINGS AROUND CRANAGE
page.content: Many years ago the vicar from the church in Holmes Chapel would ride on horseback from his vicarage to church. Now he has a much more modern house,and of course a car.The old vicarage has been modernised and extended and is now a hotel and restaurant called "The Old Vicarage"! There is a much smaller inn on Middlewich Road which also serves meals. The other notable building in the area is the animal feed factory. This used to be a mill powered by the River Dane. Now the mill is no longer there, but has been replaced by other factory buildings and storage units. There are also two churches in the area, the Methodist Church and a nineteeth century chapel. The church is on the Holmes Chapel Cranage border,the chapel is for the farms.
